titleStmt.title: Business telegram from George Bleistein to J. M. Schwoob, April 23, 1913
titleStmt.sponsor: Supported in part by a grant from the Wyoming Cultural Trust Fund, a program of the Department of State Parks and Cultural Resources.

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: George Bleistein business telegram to J. M. Schwoob

msIdentifier.repository: McCracken Research Library, MS407 Bronson Rumsey Collection

note.p:
Form 168
THE WESTERN UNION TELEGRAPH COMPANY
Incorporated
25,000 Offices in America.
Cable Service To All The World
This Company TRANSMITS and DELIVERS messages only on conditions limiting its liability, which have been assented to by the sender of the following message.
Errors can be guarded against only by repeating a message back to the sending station for comparison, and the Company will not hold itself liable for errors or delays in transmission or delivery of Unrepeated Messages, beyond the amount of tolls paid thereon, nor in any case beyond the sum of Fifty Dollars, at which, unless otherwise stated below, this message has been valued by the sender thereof, not in any case where the claim is not presented in writning within sixty days after the message is filed with the Company for transmission.
This is an UNREPEATED MESSAGE, and is delivered by request of the sender, under the conditions named above.
THEO. N. VAIL, PRESIDENT
BELVIDERE BROOKS, GENERAL MANAGER

opener.note: 8 weeks registered, be right to train now

div1.p: Give Davis credit for one hundred if Beck says so See if you can get and express me a good airdale terrier between four and ten months old.
